div.ab:
بسم اللّه الرَّحمن الرّحيم
منشور تقدّم بكتبه المولي الملك العادل
الحمد للّه وبه توفيقي
السّيّد الأجل الكبير العالم المويد المظفَّر
المنصور المرابط الهمام سيف الدّين ناصر الإسلام
معين الإمام غياث الأنام جلال الدّولَة
تاج الملَّة مجير الأمّة سيّد الملوك والسَّلاطين
سُلطان جيوش المسلمين قامع الكفرة
والمشركين أبو بكر بن أيّوب خليل أمير المومنين
قرن اللّه النفاذ بنهيه وأمره وأنطق
ألسن العباد بحمده وشكره ونوّر بالحسنات
مواقيت ليله وساعات فجره وأحيا الآمالَ
بما يمطره سحاب سيبه ويمتد به أيّام برّه
وتضمينه أنّا لم نزل وللّه الحمد نذب عن الرّعَايَا
الّذين فوّض اللّه تعالى أمرهم إلينا وأحالت
الشّريعة الطّاهرة في حياطَتِهم عَلَينا
فنكف كف الأذي عنهم ونجازي علي
الإحسَان من سلك طريقَه منهُم
ونُقيل عثرتهم ونكشف كربتهم وغمّتهم
ونضاعف ذلك لبطاركتهم ورهبَانهم
وقِسِّيْسيهم وكهّانهم وساكني
الصّوامع من زهّادهم والمنقطعين بالدّيرَة
من عُبَّادهم ونقدِّم عليهم من ارتضو تقديمه
وتقدّمنا بأن يجروا رهبان هذا
الدّير المذكور على عادتهم المستمرّة
ويقرّوا على القاعدة المستتبّة المستقرّة
وأن يتوخّوا بالرّعاية والحماية والحياطة
والكِلَاية ويمنع من يتعرّض لأذيّتهم أو
يطمع في مضرّتهم أو يتعدّى بقطع
رسومهم الجاري بها مَاضي عادتهم أو
يتطرّق لإخافة سبيلهم المسلُوك لزيارتهم
وأن لا يفسح للعُربان وَلا لغيرهم من الموافقين
والمخالفين لهم في الأديَان في اهتضامهم
ولا في تكليفهم نقض ما أُقِرُّوا عَلَيه من
أحكامهم ولا يعارض زوّارهم من البلاد الشّاميّة بوجه من وجوه إضرار أو أذيّة
وسبيل كل واقف على هذا المثال
من الأمَرا والولاة أجمعين أيّدهم اللّه والنّوّاب
وكافّة المستخدمين حمل الأمر على حكمه
والانتها إلى واجب رسمه والإنكار علَي
من خالَفه بعد علمه عاملين
بفحواه معتمدين على العلامة
الشّريفة في أعلاه إن شا اللّه تعالى
كتب سادس عشر المحرّم من سنة اثنتين وتسعين وخمس مائة
الحمد للّه وحده وصلَّى اللّهُ علَي سيّدنا محمّد وآله الطّاهرين
وسلّم تسليما كثيرا
وحسبنا اللّه ونعم الوكيل

bi smi ăl lāhi ăr raḥmāni ăr raḥīmi
manšūr:un taqaddama bi katbi hi ăl mawlà ăl maliku ăl ʿādilu
ăl ḥamdu li l lāhi wa bi hi tawfīq ī
ăs sayyidu ăl ʾaǧallu ăl kabīru ăl ʿālimu ăl muʾayyadu ăl muẓaffaru
ăl manṣūru ăl murābiṭu ăl humāmu sayfu ăd dīni nāṣiru ăl ʾislāmi
muʿīnu ăl ʾimāmi ġiyāṯu ăl ʾanāmi ǧalālu ăd dawlaẗi
tāǧu ăl millaẗi muǧīru ăl ʾummaẗi sayyidu ăl mulūki wa ăs salāṭīni
sulṭānu ǧuyūši ăl muslimīna qāmiʿu ăl kafaraẗi
wa ăl mušrikīna ʾabū bakri bni ʾayyūba ḫalīlu ʾamīri ăl muʾminīna
qarana ăl lāhu ăn nafāḏa bi nahyi hi wa ʾamri hi wa ʾanṭaqa
ʾalsuna ăl ʿibādi bi ḥamdi hi wa šukri hi wa nawwara bi ăl ḥasanāti
mawāqīta layli hi wa sāʿāti faǧri hi wa ʾaḥyā ăl ʾāmāla
bi mā yamṭuru hu saḥābu saybi hi wa yamtaddu bi hi ʾayyāmu birri hi
wa taḍmīnu hu ʾan nā lam nazal wa li l lāhi ăl ḥamdu naḏubbu ʿani ăr raʿāyā
ăllaḏīna fawwaḍa ăl lāhu taʿālà ʾamra hum ʾilay nā wa ʾaḥālat
ăš šarīʿaẗu ăṭ ṭāhiraẗu fī ḥiyāṭati him ʿalay nā
fa nakuffu kaffa ăl ʾaḏà ʿan hum wa nuǧāzī ʿalà
ăl ʾiḥsāni man salaka ṭarīqa hu min hum
wa nuqīlu ʿaṯrata hum wa nakšifu kurbata hum wa ġummata hum
wa nuḍāʿifu ḏālika li baṭārikati him wa ruhbāni him
wa qissīsī him wa kuhhāni him wa sākinī
ăṣ ṣawāmiʿi min zuhhādi him wa ăl munqaṭiʿīna bi ăd diyaraẗi
min ʿubbādi him wa nuqaddimu ʿalay him mani ĭrtaḍaw taqdīma hu
wa taqaddamnā bi ʾan yuǧrū ruhbāna hāḏā
ăd dayri ăl maḏkūri ʿalà ʿādati himi ăl mustamirraẗi
wa yuqirrū ʿalà ăl qāʿidaẗi ăl mustatabbaẗi ăl mustaqirraẗi
wa ʾan yatawaḫḫaw bi ăr riʿāyaẗi wa ăl ḥimāyaẗi wa ăl ḥiyāṭaẗi
wa ăl kilāyaẗi wa yamnaʿa man yataʿarraḍu li ʾaḏiyyati him ʾaw
yaṭmaʿu fī maḍarrati him ʾaw yataʿaddà bi qaṭʿi
rusūmi him ăl ǧārī bi hā māḍī ʿādati him ʾaw
yataṭarraqu li ʾiḫāfaẗi sabīli himi ăl maslūki li ziyārati him
wa ʾan lā yufsaḥa li l ʿurbāni wa lā li ġayri him mina ăl muwāfiqīna
wa ăl muḫālifīna la hum fī ăl ʾadyāni fī ĭhtiḍāmi him
wa lā fī taklīfi him naqḍa mā ʾuqirrū ʿalay hi min
ʾaḥkāmi him wa lā yuʿāraḍa zuwwāru hum mina ăl bilādi ăš šāmiyyaẗi bi waǧh:in min wuǧūhi ʾiḍrār:in ʾaw ʾaḏiyyaẗ:in
wa sabīlu kulli wāqif:in ʿalà hāḏā ăl miṯāli
mina ăl ʾumarāʾi wa ăl wulāẗi ʾaǧmaʿīna ʾayyada humu ăl lāhu wa ăn nuwwābi
wa kāffaẗi ăl mustaḫdamīna ḥamlu ăl ʾamri ʿalà ḥukmi hi
wa ăli ĭntihāʾu ʾilà wāǧibi rasmi hi wa ăl ʾinkāru ʿalà
man ḫālafa hu baʿda ʿilmi hi ʿāmilīna
bi faḥwā hu muʿtamidīna ʿalà ăl ʿalāmaẗi
ăš šarīfaẗi fī ʾaʿlā hu ʾin šāʾa ăl lāhu taʿālà
kutiba sādisa ʿašara ăl muḥarrami min sanaẗi ĭṯnatayni wa tisʿīna wa ḫamsi miʾaẗ:in
ăl ḥamdu li l lāhi waḥda hu wa ṣallà ăl lāhu ʿalà sayyidi nā muḥammad:in wa ʾāli hi ăṭ ṭāhirīna
wa sallama taslīm:an kaṯīr:an
wa ḥasbu nā ăl lāhu wa niʿma ăl wakīlu

In the name of God, the Merciful, the Compassionate.
This is an open decree, the order for the writing of which was given by the Master, the Victorious King [al-Malik al-ʿĀdil],
Praise be to God, who is the cause of my success.
the Most Excellent, Great, Learned, Divinely Assisted, Triumphant,
Victorious, Combating, Heroic Lord, Sword of Religion, Helper of Islam,
Assistant of the Imam, Succour of Mankind, Majesty of Empire,
Crown of the Muslim Denomination, Protector of the Community, Lord of Kings and Sultans,
Sultan of the Armies of the Muslims, Subduer of Unbelievers
and Polytheists, Abū Bakr, son of Ayyūb, Friend of the Commander of the Faithful,
may God make valid his orders and prohibitions, make the tongues
of men speak his praise and thanks, illuminate by good deeds
the times of his nights and the hours of his dawns, revive hopes
through the bounties which his clouds rain and in which his beneficient days are spent;
and [he ordered] to include in it as follows: We never cease, thank God, to protect the subjects
whose affairs were entrusted by God to us, and whose welfare was put
by the pure [religious] Law into our hands;
we remove harmful hand from them, and reward those of them
who follow the path of benevolence;
we forgive their stumbling, and avert their sorrow and misfortune.
We double this for their patriarchs and monks,
priests and clergymen, their ascetics
who inhabit cells, and religious who retreat into monasteries;
and we appoint as their superiors those whom they prefer.
We have ordered to treat the monks of the aforementioned
monastery according to their old-established custom
and to leave them to follow their long-settled and agreed rules,
and to accord to them protection, guarding, safe-keeping
and defence; to prevent people from doing them harm or
from intending damage against them, or from transgressing by changing
their current customs,
of from proceeding to render unsafe the road which is used for visits to them;
and that the Bedouins, or for that matter anyone else, whether of the same religion as they
or not, be kept from oppressing them
or forcing them to relinquish the rules according to which they have been
treated; and that visitors to them from Syria be not interfered with in any manner of harm or damage.
Let all amīrs and governors
(may God assist them), lieutenants,
and officials in general, who become aware of this ordinance, be sure to act according to its order
and follow its instruction and to disapprove of
those who knowingly contravene it - acting
in conformity with it and relying upon the noble signature
above it, if God (may He be exalted) wills.
Written this sixteenth of Muḥarram, the year Five-hundred Ninety Two.
Praise be to God alone, and may God bless our lord Muḥammad and his pure family
and give them much peace.
God is sufficient for us; how good a Keeper is He!
